data.title: Hearty breakfast close to my hotel
data.text: I got tired of eating hotel food and stumbled upon this place. Good ol' eggs bacon and pancakes with coffee for under $10.

data.title: Great Value
data.text: They are nice, it's clean and they offer a $3.99 breakfast for seniors that is more than enough food to fill you up.

data.title: A Throwback Lunch in Burbank
data.text:
Met my cousin for lunch at this '50s-style grill.  It's a smallish place with lots of vintage photos of Elvis and the 4 Seasons on the wall, mini-juke boxes at each table (though mostly featuring music from the '70s and '80s), and "Little Deuce Coupe" playing softly in the background.  The atmosphere wasn't bad.

I thought the food was OK.  My avocado, tomato and mushroom omelet was a bit long on tomato, short on the other ingredients.  My cousin said her patty melt was good.  Our dessert was a chocolate ice cream and raspberry sherbet pairing, and that's a combo that always works. 

The place seemed clean, and while the service could have been quicker and my requested glass of water never did show up, the server knew the menu well and was pleasant enough.  

As I said, it was OK.

data.title: Not sure if it is me or people just trying to be nice...
data.text:
I am not a connoisseur or trying to evaluate this place against a Michelin Star restaurant.  I am here just to report the facts as they have happened to me.  I have been here a couple of time and in both cases the service was OK to good and the food was less than pleasing. The first time I visited I tried the chicken finger, thinking it is pretty hard to mess this up...  and yet, to my surprise two of the 5 were still cold, not frozen, just cold.  I waited a couple of months and tried again, this time I ordered the chicken fried steak and chili cheese fries...

I don't recommend this place at all, the price is just not worth the disappointment.

data.title: Yum
data.text: Excellent breakfast, and very attentive service. Prices were better than I expected for the area, too.

data.title: We Found Our Spot!
data.text: Most enjoyable meal we have had in Burbank! Beautifully decorated, love the old music and outside dining is available as well. Top-notch waitress and the meal itself was fantastic.  Fish and chips are my favorite, but the original burger was a hit for the family.  This meal was twice as good as our previous restaurant and half the price! Two meals and dessert under $25 - we will come back several times on this vacation!!!

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: I always have breakfast here. Service is fast, the food is good. I had a senior special this time, a breakfast sandwich and potatoes for about $4.00. It was perfect!

data.title: Wonderful Waitress, great Owner
data.text: Stopped by after debating about many other places for food along the village streets. Glad we did. Has something for everyone. Breakfast all day. Home cooked and delicious. Custom orders,  no problem. Will be back!

data.title: Fast and Easy Delivery
data.text: Staying at a hotel by the Burbank airport I was given a long list of places that had delivery. Though the minimum for delivery is $20 and with the low prices that can make it hard for a single person ordering food I was able to top it off with extra bottles of soda pop for the room. The food was fast in arriving, tasty and the delivery person was quite friendly. Overall it was an easy place to order from and I am likely to order again.

data.title: Great little place for breakfast.
data.text: Had breakfast with my family here each day for a week whilst on vacation staying at a nearby hotel. Great value for money. Fed six of us for a very reasonable price and we all enjoyed the food. Good people too. Loved it.

data.title: Great burger and great service!
data.text: The burger and fries are great here! I had bacon and cheese added with avocado! Very tasty!! The service was superb! The guys in this small diner work hard during lunch hour!! Thank you, sincerely your Perrier girl!

data.title: Nice atmosphere and music with not-so-bad burgers
data.text:
A 50s-style restaurant with average burgers but with terrific chilli… seriously, you must try it if you stop by this place. Service was a little bit on the slow side (even though we were practically the only ones in the place) but the waiter was extremely helpful and understanding when my girlfriend spilled the soda before leaving.

I would definitely go back for the "chilli con carne" and maybe a cheesesteak or something different than a burger. 

By the way, the bathrooms were not particularly clean and had to wait for quite a while before using it since one of the cooks (apparently) was in there for several minutes.

data.title: Ok
data.text: Stop by for breakfast. .nice place..ambiance is ok. But service is slow. Really? How long does it take to cook a couple of eggs and pancakes in a very slow morning?

data.title: 50's Theme
data.text: Old fashioned food and Price was brilliant and staff very friendly.  Loved the Juke Box.  Don't miss it if you remember old songs from 50-70's era.

data.title: Great food and great people!!!
data.text: We went into the Great Grill 25 mins prior to their closing time. Although we were concerned about the time, every single person that worked there was happy to serve us, came and talked with us and did not mind that they had to close 25 mins late. They understood that we wanted to take our time and did not hurry us to leave. Instead they came and visited with us and asked about our trip, etc. Thanks for such awesome service...

data.title: Loved the Breakfast
data.text: From start to finish, the breakfasts were perfect. Good coffee, eggs cooked perfectly, toast just right. I also like this place for lunch. Good burger and fries and good sandwiches. Avoid the dinner plates, which are mediocre at best.

data.title: Great Breakfast!!
data.text: We just happened upon Great Grill when a restaurant that was recommended to us was not open yet.  We both had the breakfast special which was eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast - standard faire.  But everything was far beyond standard.  The bacon was tasty, not greasy, eggs prepared exactly as ordered and wonderfully seasoned potatoes.  Orange juice was fresh and tasty and all the portions were very generous!  We highly recommend this place for breakfast and suspect that other meals there are equally well prepared and a great value!

data.title: Good but not great
data.text:
Good burgers served in a 50s-style setting. We haven't tried any other menu items so it's hard to judge the overall quality of the food.  What we found curious on our visits is the lack of 
business.  Can't say it because of the food or time of day.

data.title: Cute place! Good food!
data.text: It was the only place open early on a Sunday morning. I had something called The Hungry Man's Omlette. It had avocado, bacon, onion, tomatoes, and cheese in it, and chili on the top!

data.title: It Really is Great!!
data.text: Nice, casual restaurant, delicious food, reasonable prices in downtown Burbank, CA.  Family friendly.  Wide variety of menu items including breakfast and lunch/dinner.  Staff was very friendly.  We would definitely say this is a "great grill"!
